instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2533: What is 820-2533? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.SYS_ONEWIRE: What is SYS_ONEWIRE? This is a bidirectional communication line between the system management controller(SMC) and the charger that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC. This must be working for the light to come on on the magsafe charger. .
definitions.SMC_BCACOK: What is SMC_BCACOK? This is a typo of SMC_BC_ACOK When you see SMC_BCACOK, assume they meant to type SMC_BC_ACOK.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2533</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b no magsafe light
threads.message:
hi, got this board that had a short on <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> near smc. very oxided. no oxidation anywhere else. received a good bath in my crest. the shorted caps were <CAPACITOR>C4902</CAPACITOR> and <CAPACITOR>C4905</CAPACITOR>.

i have no fan spin not even shorting smcon naturally, but i do not even have magsafe light. i tried another magsafe daughterboard but stll nope. using an OEM 85watt. the weird part is that
Adapter sense is 3.3v
smd_bc_acok_ vcc is 3.3v
<SIGNAL>SYS_ONEWIRE</SIGNAL> is 3.3v
<SIGNAL>SMC_BCACOK</SIGNAL> is 3.3v
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> is 3.34v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2533</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b no magsafe light
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2533</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b no magsafe light
threads.message:
Reballing smc did nothing. Today my donor arrived, replaced smc but nothing. After replacing <CHIP>U6901</CHIP> sys one wire was gone. I checked on diode mode under smc with donor and found out sys one wire had a value completely wrong. Turns out the via was damaged but not too much. A small bridge fixed the machine. Got light and fan spin

[img]https://i.imgur.com/bxjEbiO.jpg[/img]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2533</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b no magsafe light
threads.message: Is the board fully working now?
